details.title: Stretch processing for masking effect removal in noise radar
details.abstract: A method of removing the masking effect caused by strong target echoes in a noise radar is presented. Signal processing in noise radar is based on the calculation of the correlation between transmitted and received signals. Strong echoes of nearby targets produce relatively high sidelobes in the correlation function, thus masking weak echoes of far targets. The classical method of masking effect removal, taking into consideration only the Doppler shift of target echoes, does not remove the strong target echo completely when targets migrate between range resolution cells in the integration time. The method proposed, based on signal stretch processing and a point target model, shows an improvement over existing methods and allows for the detection of weak targets also in the presence of the fast and strong ones.

ieee.title: Analysis of mainlobe to mean square sidelobe ratio in noise radar
ieee.displayText: Yuanbing Cheng, Xiyuan Tang, Wei Zhang, Hong Gu, Weimin Su, "Analysis of mainlobe to mean square sidelobe ratio in noise radar", Radar (Radar) 2011 IEEE CIE International Conference on, vol. 2, pp. 1075-1078, 2011.

ieee.title: Ground clutter suppression using noise radar with dual-frequency transmitter
ieee.displayText: Jinli Chen, Xiuzai Zhang, Jiaqiang Li, Hong Gu, "Ground clutter suppression using noise radar with dual-frequency transmitter", Information Science and Technology (ICIST) 2012 International Conference on, pp. 873-877, 2012.

ieee.title: SAR implementation using LFM signal
ieee.displayText: N Ganveer, G Vishal, Ranjan S Rao, Vivekananda Biradar, "SAR implementation using LFM signal", Recent Trends in Electronics Information & Communication Technology (RTEICT) IEEE International Conference on, pp. 1094-1097, 2016.

ieee.title: Sensitivity of cancellation algorithm to transmitted waveform in noise radar system
ieee.displayText: Yuping Zhang, Yunjie Li, Leilei Jin, Meiguo Gao, "Sensitivity of cancellation algorithm to transmitted waveform in noise radar system", Signal Processing (ICSP) 2014 12th International Conference on, pp. 246-251, 2014, ISSN 2164-5221.

ieee.title: Suppressing sidelobe levels in random phase modulated radar
ieee.displayText: Hamed Haghshenas, Mohammad M. Nayebi, "Suppressing sidelobe levels in random phase modulated radar", Radar Conference (RADAR) 2011 IEEE, pp. 530-532, 2011, ISSN 1097-5659.

ieee.title: A sparse optimization method for masking effect removal in noise synthetic aperture radar
ieee.displayText: Xiao Dong, Yunhua Zhang, Wenshuai Zhai, "A sparse optimization method for masking effect removal in noise synthetic aperture radar", Geoscience and Remote Sensing Symposium (IGARSS) 2016 IEEE International, pp. 6811-6814, 2016, ISSN 2153-7003.

ieee.title: Viable/Inviable Polynomial-Phase Modulations for "Stretch Processing"
ieee.displayText: Lina Yeh, Kainam Thomas Wong, Hasan Saeed Mir, "Viable/Inviable Polynomial-Phase Modulations for "Stretch Processing"", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 48, pp. 923-926, 2012, ISSN 0018-9251.

ieee.title: Low-rate sampling technique for range-windowed radar/sonar using nonlinear frequency modulation
ieee.displayText: Hasan Saeed Mir, Uae Kainam Thomas Wong, "Low-rate sampling technique for range-windowed radar/sonar using nonlinear frequency modulation", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 51, pp. 1972-1979, 2015, ISSN 0018-9251.
